page.title: 13THE PORTWAY
page.content: The{Portway}is a track and a road running along the crest of the {Longmynd.}It is a worn out path which is now filled with pebbles in the ground.It is a bumpy path and was known as the{King's Highway}in the {Middle Ages. It is not known whether the Portway was made by the{Romans}or by the earlier people. On the track in the Southern part of the{Longmynd,}a lady called{Miss {Chitty}has traced thousands of pieces of flint,used by early civilisations. The{Celts}made{barrows,}which were rounded burial grounds,and traces of twenty-four of them have been found on the Portway.
